insect.coverage.execution
Class Executor

java.lang.Object
  insect.coverage.execution.Executor
public class Executor
extends java.lang.Object

Executes an instrumented program with the given arguments within a single instance of the VM.

Author:
Anil Chawla

          Creates a new Executor for the program specified in the given resource file.

Method Detail

execute

public boolean execute(java.lang.String execID,
                       java.lang.String[] classPathNames,
                       java.lang.String main,
                       java.lang.String[] args)
Method to actually execute the instrumented program.

Parameters:
execID - identifier for this execution
classPathNames - array of additional classpath names
main - fully qualified name of main class
args - arguments to the main class
Returns:
true if execution seemed to have succeeded, otherwise false

initMonitors

public void initMonitors()
Manually inits all monitors.

quitMonitors

public void quitMonitors()
Manually quits all monitors.

exitVM

public void exitVM()
Wrapper to the System.exit(0) method. In multithreaded applications (such as those with Swing/AWT) the created threads will remain alive even after execution is complete, and the "main" thread dies. Therefore, this method must be called when the invoking program is ready to exit the VM.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Main method for command line usage.
